question.title: exception trace does not show line number for private method after use ProGuard

node.contents: for example, the followng error message shows that NullPointerException thrown from line number 435 in GameController.java:

astNode.text: for example, the followng error message shows that NullPointerException thrown from line number 435 in GameController.java:

elements.contents: java.lang.NullPointerException at com.fuu.mahjong.game.GameController.boolean showHint(boolean)(GameController.java:435) at com.fuu.mahjong.game.GameViewActivity.boolean onTouch(android.view.View,android.view.MotionEvent)(GameViewAct ivity.java:1552) at android.view.View.dispatchTouchEvent(View.java:7122) at android.view.ViewGroup.dispatchTransformedTouchEvent(ViewGroup.java:2176) ...

node.contents: clearCurrentSelections() is a private method in GameController, the error message does not show trace information inside clearCurrentSelections(), if I change clearCurrentSelections() to public, then the error message shows that which line in clearCurrentSelections() cause the NullPointerException.

astNode.text: clearCurrentSelections() is a private method in GameController, the error message does not show trace information inside clearCurrentSelections(), if I change clearCurrentSelections() to public, then the error message shows that which line in clearCurrentSelections() cause the NullPointerException.

node.contents: Is there any way to show the trace information inside a private method after use ProGuard?

astNode.text: Is there any way to show the trace information inside a private method after use ProGuard?

node.contents: ProGuard's optimization step has probably inlined the method. The virtual machine then produces fewer lines in the stack trace. If you want to avoid this, you can disable method inlining:

astNode.text: ProGuard's optimization step has probably inlined the method. The virtual machine then produces fewer lines in the stack trace. If you want to avoid this, you can disable method inlining:

node.contents: On the Dalvik virtual machine, method inlining improves the performance though.

astNode.text: On the Dalvik virtual machine, method inlining improves the performance though.

node.contents: Whether the method is private or not shouldn't matter for the optimization, unless your configuration explicitly keeps public methods.

astNode.text: Whether the method is private or not shouldn't matter for the optimization, unless your configuration explicitly keeps public methods.
